overview.name: COVID-19 image data collection
overview.detailed_description: In the context of a COVID-19 pandemic, we want to improve prognostic predictions to triage and manage patient care. Data is the first step to developing any diagnostic/prognostic tool. While there exist large public datasets of more typical chest X-rays from the NIH [Wang 2017], Spain [Bustos 2019], Stanford [Irvin 2019], MIT [Johnson 2019] and Indiana University [Demner-Fushman 2016], there is no collection of COVID-19 chest X-rays or CT scans designed to be used for computational analysis.
overview.licence: Each image has license specified in the metadata.csv file. Including Apache 2.0, CC BY-NC-SA 4.0, CC BY 4.0. The metadata.csv, scripts, and other documents are released under a CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license.
overview.use_case: This dataset can be used to generate models which can identify COVID19 patients from CXR and CT scans

imaging_reports.view: Posteroanterior (PA), Anteroposterior (AP), AP Supine (APS), or Lateral (L) for X-rays; Axial or Coronal for CT scans. Translations: Bettaufnahme->Supine, Liegend->Supine
imaging_reports.source: URL of the paper or website where the image came from
imaging_reports.clinical_notes: Clinical notes about the image and/or the patient
